duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise assigned staff and ensure quality services for participants.
Lead the Victim Advocate team and coordinate with Case Management and Outreach teams.
Appraise performance, reward, and address performance deficiencies through coaching and corrective action.
Provide leadership in the recruitment and enrollment of participants and conduct individual interviews and assessments.
Oversee crisis response to shootings and homicides, notify victim advocates of the need for a response, and be available to provide guidance.

Maintain a caseload of participants and monitor cases by verifying attendance, observing and evaluating activities and responses, advocating for needed services, intervening in crises, and providing personal support.
Prepare participants' exit strategy by reviewing goals and individualized plans, coordinating discharge and post-discharge requirements, and providing resources.
Develop partnerships with resources that will strengthen support for participants and hold partners accountable as needed.
Coordinate with Outreach Program Manager and Outreach Supervisor around cases and community activities.

education_certification.credential: BS in a Human Services field (i.e.: Sociology, Urban Studies, Social Work) or equivalent experience
